alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 9:10PM EST until January 14 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... White River. .Rainfall of 1.00 to 1.50 inches across southwestern Indiana this past Saturday night is prolonging minor flooding on the lower White River, from near Petersburg to Hazleton. The river level is expected to hover less than two feet above flood stage until Thursday at which point it should drop below flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Hazleton. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Flood water is near or starting on Pottsville Road. Low bottomlands are increasingly affected by flood waters. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Thursday evening and continue falling to 8.4 feet Friday, January 21. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Wednesday morning by around 1100 AM CST /1200 PM EST/.
